alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:14PM EDT until April 05 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...SOUTHWESTERN CLARENDON AND EAST CENTRAL ORANGEBURG COUNTIES... At 713 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Santee State Park, or 18 miles southwest of Manning, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. This storm has a history of producing tornadoes! IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Summerton around 725 PM EDT. Santee Cooper Regional Airport around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Santee, Davis Station, Stumphole Landing, Poplar Creek Landing, St. Paul and Paxville. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 94 and 118. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately. Being in a vehicle during a tornado is not safe. Drive to the closest sturdy building and move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor. As a last resort, abandon your car and seek shelter in a ditch or low lying area away from trees. Do not seek shelter under highway overpasses.
